paper_abstract: The zeta function of a finite automaton A is exp{Sigma(infinity)(n=1) a(n) z(n)/n} where a(n) is the number of bi-infinite paths in A labelled by a bi-infinite word of period n. It reflects the properties of A: apenodicity, nil-simplicity, existence of a zero. The results are applied to codes. (c) 2007 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: On a zeta function associated with automata and codes
